member.summary: Returns the items that are visible in a given container.

member.typeparam: The type of items being tested
member.param: The items being tested; typically the children of a StackPanel
The viewport to test visibility against; typically a ScrollViewer
Whether to check for vertical or horizontal visibility
member.returns: The items that are (at least partially) visible

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.GetVisibleItems``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.Controls.Orientation,System.Collections.Generic.List{``0}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{``0}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{``0}@)
member.summary: Returns the items that are visible in a given container plus the invisible ones before and after.
member.remarks: This function assumes that items are ordered top-to-bottom or left-to-right; if items are in random positions it won't work
member.typeparam: The type of items being tested
member.param: The items being tested; typically the children of a StackPanel
The viewport to test visibility against; typically a ScrollViewer
Wether to check for vertical or horizontal visibility
List to be populated with items that precede the visible items
List to be populated with the items that are visible
List to be populated with the items that follow the visible items

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.GetVisualDescendents(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Performs a breadth-first enumeration of all the descendents in the tree
member.returns: An enumerator of all the children

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.GetVisualDescendents``1(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns all the descendents of a particular type
member.typeparam: The type to look for
member.param: Whether to stop searching the tree after the first set of items are found
member.remarks: The allAtSameLevel flag is used to control enumeration through the tree. For many cases (eg, finding ListBoxItems in a ListBox) you want enumeration to stop as soon as you've found all the items in the ListBox (no need to search further in the tree). For other cases though (eg, finding all the Buttons on a page) you want to exhaustively search the entire tree

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.PrintDescendentsTree(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Print the entire visual element tree of an item to the debug console
member.param: The item whose descendents should be printed

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.GetChildTree(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Returns a list of descendents, formatted with indentation
member.param: The item whose tree should be returned
The prefix for this level of hierarchy
The string to add for the next level
A list that will contain the items on return

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.PrintAncestorTree(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Prints the visual ancestor tree for an item to the debug console
member.param: The item whost ancestors you want to print

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.GetAncestorVisualTree(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Returns a list of ancestors
member.param: The node whose ancestors you want
A list that will contain the children

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.GetVerticalScrollOffset(System.Windows.Controls.ListBox)
member.summary: Gets the vertical offset for a ListBox

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.GetHorizontalScrollOffset(System.Windows.Controls.ListBox)
member.summary: Gets the horizontal offset for a ListBox

member.name: F:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.workItems
member.summary: List of work to do on the next render (at the end of the current tick)

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.ScheduleOnNextRender(System.Action)
member.summary: Schedules work to happen at the end of this tick, when the event is raised
member.remarks: Typically you can schedule work using Dispatcher.BeginInvoke, but sometimes that will result in a single-frame glitch of the visual tree. In that case, use this method.

member.name: T:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.VisibleSearchMode
member.summary: Simple enumeration used in the state machine of GetVisibleItems

member.name: F:MyToolkit.UI.TransformCreationMode.None
member.summary: Don't try and create a transform if it doesn't already exist

member.name: F:MyToolkit.UI.TransformCreationMode.Create
member.summary: Create a transform if none exists

member.name: F:MyToolkit.UI.TransformCreationMode.AddToGroup
member.summary: Create and add to an existing group

member.name: F:MyToolkit.UI.TransformCreationMode.CombineIntoGroup
member.summary: Create a group and combine with existing transform; may break existing animations

member.name: F:MyToolkit.UI.TransformCreationMode.IgnoreIdentityMatrix
member.summary: Treat identity matrix as if it wasn't there; may break existing animations

member.name: F:MyToolkit.UI.TransformCreationMode.CreateOrAddAndIgnoreMatrix
member.summary: Create a new transform or add to group

member.name: F:MyToolkit.UI.TransformCreationMode.Default
member.summary: Default behaviour, equivalent to CreateOrAddAndIgnoreMatrix

member.name: P:MyToolkit.Paging.BindableApplicationBar.MiniSize
